reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Getting there;
reviews.title: Info on stay and area

reviews.text: The free shuttle provided by the Pan Am is excellent, arrived JFK phoned hotel and they were there for the pick up in 10mins. worth giving driver a good tip, youv'e just saved $50 in taxi fares.
reviews.title: The staff was great....

reviews.text: Hotel;
reviews.title: Great place to stay - 35 minutes to Manhattan

likes.liked: — Much cheaper than anything equivalent in Manhattan
likes.disliked: — R train stops running after midnight

reviews.text: Check in easy,staff friendly, we had room on 6th floor overlooking Queens Boulevard, an air hostess sharing transport said there may be some noise from the entertainment in the hotel bar over weekend, but never heard a thing- see last comment on other noise. Room, good size and was clean, ad a small fridge, the bathroom was okay but needed updating. Vending machines on the landings as well as ice machines. There as a restaurant/bar on ground floor, we had breakfast and it was good ( see eating comment for other suggestion).
reviews.title: Much more than expected

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Internet access on ground floor 2 x stations and telephones also.
reviews.title: Cheap and fairly nasty
You get what you pay for- not much
reviews.text: One good thing about hotel, the price. But the negatives were major. The drains in the bathoom were clogged. We complained but it never got fixed. We found dirty underwear in our bed that was not ours, obviously left over from a prior guest. Booked a non-smoking room two months ago and they put us in a supposedly non-smoking room, but it smelled of smoke. We asked to be moved and got moved 3 times. Each time, same problem, a supposedly non smoking room smelled of smoke. The one we ended up in did not have any "no-smoking" sign. Would not stay there again.

reviews.title: Pan American Hotel
reviews.text: Hotel was very clean. Staff was friendly and helpful. Room was clean. Hotel was very quiet.
We liked the room and was upgraded to a suite. The food at the restaurant was good. I would stay again. good room-good price.
reviews.title: Life is good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for three nights, and had a great time. The room was large and clean, and was cleaned everyday, the staff was friendly and helped us sort out everything from the best subway line to take to Manhatten to calling a cab to take us to the train station. The restaurant accompanying this hotel is also very good and not expensive at all! Good breakfast (large portions!).
reviews.title: Very good!

likes.liked: — The large, clean rooms and the excellent breakfast.
likes.disliked: — It was hard to return to at night, because the nearest subway station closes after 10PM.

reviews.text: Seeing that the hotel is only a 10-minute ride away from the subway entrance at Central Park, I would absolutely recommend this hotel to anybody wishing to stay in New York for a normal price, instead of the ridiculous fares they charge you in Manhattan hotels.
reviews.title: Pan Am hotel was cool

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just back from a 2 week trip trip to New York and would definitely recommend staying at the Pan American. The hotel itself was fine, staff were always helpful, the room was fine, decent size, comfortable bed, in need of some redecoration though but not bad. The only negative about the hotel was the noise at night, the soundproofing is not great and guests quite happily slam their doors late at night and early morning, we had a room at the side of the hotel overlooking the car park, but there were some noisy fans/generators which seemed to kick in at random times of the day.
reviews.title: Excellent value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The area is 99% chinese/ korean and felt reasonably safe with no hassles. Pop diner for breakfast was good, boca juniors (argentinian restaurant) is ok but quantity over quality (great if you are really hungry the portions are huge), loads more eating places further out past the Queens Mall (excellent shopping) further down the Queens Boulevard, however we ate mostly in manhattan. The subway is about 1o min walk with direct trains to manhattan midtown taking about 20 mins, the latest we got the subway back was about 1.30am and i was concerned about travelling so late at night
reviews.title: very good

likes.liked: — good price for basic but clean and comfortable accomodation
likes.disliked: — ideally would have been easier to be closer to manhattan

reviews.text: but we neednt have worried, trains were busy with no trouble and the walk back to the hotel was fine but as with any big city it pays to be aware of your surroundings and don't get blase.
reviews.title: Pan American is my hotel for future vists to NYC

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In summary if you don't mind staying out of the biz of manhattan this is definitely the hotel for you.
reviews.title: A recommended place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: choose this hotel as we were booking at short notice and found limited availability elsewhere close to the city. very reasonably priced, with helpful staff. Benefits of this hotel included free airport shuttle (which was very efficient). internet access in the lobby and easy access to downtown manhattan (10 minutes walk away - approx 30 mins subway journey downdown).
reviews.title: Ideal for the airports

likes.liked: — Clean and comforatble, near to airport

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: the ride from jfk to the hotel was great the driver pointed out great points of interest how to get around places to eat this was of course the free pick up via the hotel
reviews.title: very average

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: the bell captain was extremely helpful and the organised tour was well worth the money and woul advise it be utilised
reviews.title: The perfect base

reviews.text: our problem was the bed and room the bed was soo uncormfatable that both me and my wife had crippling back pain and very little sleep we were only there three days but we welcomed our own bed after three very uncormfatable nights the decor was a little tired and is in need of some decoration but apart from that everything was ok
reviews.title: You get what you pay for
Problems with Hotel and Staff
reviews.text: We stayed here for 3 nights from 9/9/07 - 12/9/07 and found it to be the perfect base to get into manhattan using the ever reliable and easy to use subway(5 blocks away,get the 1 week metro card,bargain)

reviews.title: Great except on Saturday nights....
reviews.text: The shuttle to & from the airport was very quick & reliable,all the staff we dealt with were very helpful & polite
